" Warning at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:433): The robot program quit unexpectedly. This is usually due to a code error.

See Reading Stacktraces — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation for more information.

what can be? sorry by my english, i’m brazilian

Somehow, you’re using a 2025 version of WPILib with a beta project that hasn’t been imported. VS Code should be prompting you to import your project every time you open it.

Because of this, the vendor dependency manager is showing you beta versions of vendor dependencies, and you have mismatched versions. For example, the version of Advantage Kit you have needs WPILib 2025.3.2, but you’re using 2025.1.1, and most of the other vendordeps need beta versions of wpilib. You need to import your project and update all your vendordeps to compatible versions.
